channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: National cabinet will meet to discuss border issues and agree upon a definition on a hotspot on Friday.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Victorian COVID-19 cases continue to decline as Daniel Andrews labels leaked lockdown roadmap 'out of date'; Australian death toll stands at 678

item.description: Apple is delaying a new privacy feature in the next version of its iPhone operating system that will make it more difficult for app makers to track people online to help sell digital ads.
item.title: Apple delays debut of anti-tracking tool in iPhone software

item.description: Rscue workers had detected signs of life in the rubble of a building in a residential area of Beirut that had collapsed after the explosion.
item.title: Lebanese army finds four tonnes of ammonium nitrate near Beirut's port

item.description: Relatives of the man, Daniel Prude, said the police officers involved in his death in March should be charged with murder.
item.title: Mayor suspends police involved in death of black man with hood placed on his head

item.description: US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo announced sanctions on Wednesday against the chief prosecutor of the court, based in The Hague, and a top aide.
item.title: 'Grave attack': France calls on US to withdraw sanctions on world court

item.dc:creator: Ashleigh McMillan
item.description: Police have charged an 18-year-old man after a woman in her 20s was allegedly stabbed on a Melbourne walking path in broad daylight.
item.title: Man charged with stalking after female jogger stabbed in Melbourne's north-west

item.description: Navalny "and his supporters are putting on a big theater play," a Russian scientist, Leonid Rink, who helped develop Novichok said in an interview on Russian state television.
item.title: For Russian media, Navalny's illness caused by anything but most likely suspect

item.description: Alibaba's Ant Group is headed for potentially the world's largest stock debut. Investors may do well to focus on the long-term threat from arch rivalÂ Tencent.
item.title: 'Brutal battle': Chinese giants Alibaba and Tencent are on a collision course

item.dc:creator: Tom Decent
item.description: The Waratahs have secured the signature of rising star Will Harrison on a new three-year deal.
item.title: Harrison signs new deal to remain at Waratahs until 2023

item.description: The US economy's economic engine may be running out of fuel as consumer spending falls.
item.title: The US economic recovery is slowing down

item.dc:creator: Latika Bourke
item.description: The former Australian prime minister's reported appointment to the UK Trade Board has caused a political storm in Westminster.
item.title: UK government faces growing criticism of Tony Abbott's British role

item.description: There will be at least two Australians in the third round of the US Open after Alex de Minaur eliminated the French veteran at Flushing Meadows.
item.title: De Minaur through to third round at US Open after dispatching Gasquet

item.description: The Australian sharemarket is set for heavy losses on Friday with Wall Street's main indexes marking their deepest one-day dives in months.
item.title: Wall Street tumbles as investors dump tech stocks

item.dc:creator: Andrew Wu
item.description: Under a proposal by the Swans and Giants chairmen, the AFL grand final would not be played exclusively at the MCG.
item.title: 'It's time': Swans, Giants call for best-of-three grand final series

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: Laine-Ella Hyland was last seen at a Southport address on Thursday, August 24, and has not been seen or heard from since.
item.title: Police issue alert for girl, 11, missing at Gold Coast

item.dc:creator: Tony Moore
item.description: Which Queensland music artists should perform at Brisbane's one-off AFL Grand Final at the Gabba on October 24?
item.title: Bernard? What about Kate, Kasey or even Barry to play at Brisbane's AFL grand final?

item.description: A solo effort up Mount Aigoual from Alexey Lutsenko gave the Kazakh rider his first victory in Le Tour while Adam Yates retained the overall lead.
item.title: Yates keeps yellow as Kazakhstan's Lutsenko takes first Tour stage win

item.description: The billionaire said he wants to increase the number of African American doctors by reducing the debt burden of students.Â
item.title: Michael Bloomberg gives $US100M to historically black medical schools

item.description: Warner Bros said in a statement that a member of The Batman production had tested positive for the coronavirus, and that filming had paused.
item.title: Robert Pattinson 'tests positive for COVID-19', pausing production of The Batman

item.dc:creator: Tim Biggs
item.description: Organised groups are carefully circumventing social media platform rules to 'disorient and overwhelm' their targets.
item.title: 'Disturbing and harmful': eSafety commissioner calls on Facebook to stop 'volumetric' trolling

item.description: The key to success with Japanese wisteria? Give it the room for those long flowers to drop and hang and sway â and prune throughout summer.
item.title: Forget lilac wisteria, there's another version that's quite the sight

item.description: The new case in a 37-year-old man is a setback for Thailand, which had been credited with keeping the highly contagious virus under control.
item.title: Thailand reports first domestic coronavirus case in 100 days

item.description: The social media giant will also attach links with official results to posts by candidates and campaigns that prematurely declare victory in November.
item.title: Facebook to ban new political ads in week before US election

item.description: Retailers pummeled by the coronavirus pandemic are frantically trying to adjust in time for the crucial holiday season.
item.title: Ho, ho, hum: US retailers bracing for a miserable Christmas

item.description: The Morrison government is considering pulling forward personal incomes tax cuts ''as a way to get people spending''.
item.title: Tax cuts will create even greater inequality

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: The university has been added to a global coalition of vaccine developers for its work on mosquito-borne viruses, but is currently focusing on a COVID-19 jab.
item.title: Griffith University partners with Indian firm for COVID-19 vaccine

item.dc:creator: Eryk Bagshaw
item.description: Australian writer Yang Hengjun has seen his lawyers for the first time since he was detained in China more than 18 months ago.
item.title: Australian detained in China declares 'I will fight to the end'

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: A total of $2.4 million has been donated to Queensland political parties since July, ahead of the state election.
item.title: Who is funding Queensland's election campaigns

item.dc:creator: Jordan Baker
item.description: Schools are hiring health workers to meet students' increasingly complex needs, but experts say they should not have to become a de facto health system.
item.title: Schools forced to address deficiencies in health system, professor warns

item.description: A common refrain among rebels in the workplace is that itâs usually easier to seek forgiveness than to seek permission.
item.title: Reasons to be a rebel at work

item.dc:creator: Sarah Danckert
item.description: Virgin Group founder Richard Branson and the union representing the bulk of workers at the collapsed airline are backing Bain Capital's $3.5 billion offer for Virgin.
item.title: Bain Capital wins support from key players ahead of meeting

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Friday, September 4

item.dc:creator: Cara Waters
item.description: Global technology giant Apple has revealed plans to invest in renewable energy projects in Australia.
item.title: Apple to invest in renewable energy projects in Australia

item.dc:creator: Nick Toscano
item.description: Clean energy investors warn grid limitations threaten to stunt the next wave of Australia's wind and solar boom.
item.title: Grid strife threatens Australia's green power switch, investors say

item.dc:creator: Shane Wright
item.description: Vouchers for holidays or direct support for people to have a restaurant meal should accompany any pull-forward of tax cuts, senior analysts say.
item.title: Tax cuts and more: Economists warn tax alone won't save country

item.dc:creator: Katina Curtis
item.description: Lisa Harvey-Smith wants to use her second term to promote structural changes that help women start and keep jobs in the sector.
item.title: Measuring what works a key focus for Women in STEM ambassador

item.dc:creator: Anthony Galloway
item.description: Malicious cyber attacks against Australian businesses and government agencies from a state-based actor have increased over the past two months, as the nation's cyber security centre is receiving reports of cyber incidents every 10 minutes.
item.title: Cyber attacks from state-based actor increasing

item.dc:creator: Anthony Galloway
item.description: A majority of Australians want the government to increase funding to developing nations to help fight coronavirus and avoid a second deadly wave sweeping the world, a survey has found.
item.title: 'Merry-go-round of suffering': Australians want more overseas COVID funding to avoid second wave

item.description: While her father was dying in Auckland, a Melbourne resident had no hope of travelling to be at his side amid the COVID-19 restrictions.
item.title: Farewell, Dad. I'm sorry I had to witness your last breath on video call

item.description: Will work change after the pandemic is over?
item.title: Shift to home work is a lesson to bosses and employees

item.dc:creator: Harry Hollinsworth
item.description: More than 100 police will be on duty for the 'siege of Sydney airport' today when pop star Normie Rowe leaves for England.
item.title: In the Herald: September 4, 1966

item.description: Following a devastating loss the previous evening, Australian swimmer John Konrads found redemption in the 1500m men's freestyle final at the Rome Olympics.
item.title: From the Archives: Brilliant swim by Konrads wins fifth gold medal

item.description: COVID-19 has made us question how we value care work.
item.title: Pandemic highlights inequalities women suffer

item.description: Trivia and word buffs: test your knowledge with today's superquiz and Target.
item.title: Target and superquiz, Friday, September 4

item.dc:creator: Julie Power
item.description: A clerical filing error in the mid-1840s meant that William Tipple Smith's claim to be the first to discover gold was lost in the mists of time.
item.title: History stands corrected: Smith, not Hargraves, first to discover gold in NSW

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, September 4, 2020

item.dc:creator: Colin Kruger
item.description: It appears the aviation industry during a global pandemic is more exciting than doing comms for our DPM Michael McCormack.
item.title: New deputy PM's staff to help reveal the real McCormack

item.dc:creator: Chip Le Grand
item.description: Businessman Paul Little is chairing a new group advising the Andrews government on its COVID response.
item.title: Business reaches out to state government on reopening economy

item.dc:creator: Richard Baker
item.description: The Victorian government's three main security contractors finished their work almost two months ago, but they're yet to be paid.
item.title: Government owes hotel quarantine security firms more than $10 million

item.description: But it will require a re-imagining of these streets as not just a strip of shops where you buy things but as the backbone of the community providing a range of services as well as goods.
item.title: Death of Melbourne's shopping strips is an opportunity for renewal
